result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Weiland

records.addlTxt:
(2:50 PM case called.) Defendant Matthew J. Weiland in court without counsel. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advises the Court would like to represent himself.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Court advises defendant to consider obtaining representation.
Defendant waives right to an attorney. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to an attorney.
Defendant requests to proceed with preliminary hearing.
State calls Officer Kienna Marshall of the Altoona Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Defendant conducts cross-examination of Officer Marshall. Witness excused.
Defendant requests speedy trial demand and requests discovery.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over for an Arraignment.
An Arraignment is to be scheduled with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.

Conditions:
No contact with J.B. or J.B's family members to include no 3rd party contact.
No use or possession of weapons. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

(11:05 AM case called.) Defendant Matthew J. Weiland appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler appeared by video for Matthew J. Weiland. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $20,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Kohler requests signature bond or if the Court is going to order cash it be between $500.00 or $1,000.00 and cites reasoning.
Court reviews the probable cause of the criminal complaint and orders $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant updates phone number with the Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with J.B. or J.B's family members to include no 3rd party contact.
No use or possession of weapons. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
